Reviews.Title: “Off the strip”
Reviews.Author: PexyScotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel casino is a total gem its way off the strip, but this hotel wouldnt be out of place on the strip, great casino floor hotel brilliant and the bars and resturants are stunning the t-bone resturant is out of this world. A Must see if in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: panamor
Reviews.Content: This La Quinta suited our needs perfectly. We found Julie to be as good as they get when it comes to making a person feel welcome, and bent over backwards to keep us happy. The room was clean, the hotel was quiet, and we will definitely return there. If it is not important for you to be on the strip, you will find this a very comfortable place to stay for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Everything as promised”
Reviews.Author: Arcadia_R
Reviews.Content: Located out in the western suburbia of Las Vegas, this is a good place to stay if you are hiking/climbing in Red Rock Canyon or for visiting businesses in the Summerlin area. Yes, it's spartan and offers few frills (could have used some hand lotion or other amenities in addition to shampoo), but it delivered everything it promised. Breakfast was not extravagant, but there were many choices available to satisfy everyone in our party of four. The rooms and common areas were clean. Generally, the La Quinta brand is a click below the Residence Inn (breakfast, amenities, extra chair in the room, for example), and that's true for this one, too. Several restaurants and other shopping are within walking distance, although you certainly need a car to get around this area. The pool seemed small and was oddly located behind a locked metal fence and gate. The outdoor perimeter lighting is extremely bright and shone through the curtains. Staff were great: the fellow at the front desk when we checked in was very helpful with restaurant suggestions; the woman in charge of breakfast ran it well. If you're planning to spend most of your time at the Strip I think there are better non-casino choices that are closer than this property, but this is a solid choice for the Summerlin area and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: madwisctraveler
Reviews.Content: That is what we were looking for....and got! The La Quinta was only a few miles from the Red Canyon Resort and Casino - so we got our gambling fix there. We always go to Red Rock Canyon and that was a short drive away. We stayed two nights - Friday and Saturday in February.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, close to Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: EarlyOut
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights, and I give it high marks. My room was a queen with a sofa, and had a fairly complete kitchen, a big flat-panel TV with loads of channels, and a good work desk. The WiFi is reasonably fast, though like most hotel connections, upload speed is pretty slow. Friendly, helpful staff. The rooms are quiet, as is the location. They have extremely bright parking lot lights, but the blackout curtains on the windows take care of that. The location is very handy if you want to head to Red Rock Canyon, and it's only a few blocks from the Rt. 215 ring road, so access to other places (like the airport) is painless. There are some decent restaurants around (if you like Thai, head for Archi's, a short walk away), and there's a grocery store within walking distance, along with a lot of other stuff. Breakfast is passable, with yogurt, cereal, lots of starchy choices (muffins, toast, a waffle maker, etc.), but nothing truly cooked, like eggs or bacon. A slightly more extensive breakfast would have gotten this review the fifth star.

Reviews.Title: “Get Away from the Craziness!”
Reviews.Author: DDreytser
Reviews.Content: An affordable option in Las Vegas suburbia, but on the edge of the mountains and very close to Red Rock Canyon. If you have a car on your visit to Las Vegas and someone intends to stay sober, why pay more! Big breakfast and easy access to highways and local shopping. The pool leaves something to be desired though. Interestingly, during our stay there were long-term locals staying at this hotel for a variety of reasons (mostly to do with extended house repairs). The fact that locals keep staying there is a sign that all should generally be okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Aquarius695
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 days at the end of January. The staff was very friendly and went above and beyond to recommend sights to see and restaurants to try in the area, as well as answering all of our tourist-type questions. The room was always cleaned and stocked with fresh towels, and the continental breakfast was decent...though right around the corner is a great breakfast place called "Hash House a Go-Go" which was featured on the TV show "Man vs Food"! The location was great for us, and for our itinerary, and also put us far enough away from the strip that the location felt extremely safe. Red Rock Canyon is only about a 10 minute drive away, and a great place for sight seeing. The strip was about 15 mins away, which was perfect for us, because we only wanted to go there a few times anyway. Overall, I'm not used to staying at an Inn like this, and tend to frequent larger and more extravagant resorts, but La Quinta not only served it's purpose but also exceeded our expectations...especially for a very inexpensive price. We intend to return!

Reviews.Title: “good people!!!”
Reviews.Author: FaustoViterbo
Reviews.Content: My name is Fausto Viterbo, and I was a guest at the hotel La Quinta, Las Vegas, from January 11th to 18th. On january 13th I fell down while walking on the street, and had a severe fracture in my left arm. I was alone and it's easy to imagine the difficulties I had to perform my daily activities with only one arm. So, I wanna say it was a big satisfaction to have been in this hotel and have met such nice people, like Jesus, who helped me taking the showers, July, Mary and Larry, all them very kind people, who did all they could to make my life easier. I'd like to congratulate this hotel and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, Comfy & Affordable”
Reviews.Author: megatraveller
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 4 day stay at this place and elected to do so because we stayed here last year and enjoyed it so much. It is a good home away from home and has everything you need - kitchen, big tv, comfy bed, etc. The pool is large and the hot tub is great after a long hike at Red Rock. Rates were around $80 per night and this included breakfast. Quite the opposite experience from the reviewer who stayed here just a few nights ahead of us!

Reviews.Title: “A older but quite comfy inn, far removed from Vegas glitz.”
Reviews.Author: WebWanderer
Reviews.Content: I chose this place because it was just about the only reasonably-priced hotel in the Summerlin area that still had a room available when I called for a reservation several days ahead of a busy holiday weekend. I was planning to visit family nearby and just needed a place to sleep as i would be gone all day, so I didn't pay much attention to the amenities when I was reserving online. I was,therefore quite surprised when I walked into my room --and found a kitchenette including a full-size refrigerator and built-in electric range, with cabinets holding dishes, etc. The staff was very attentive. One example: on my way to the small dining room for breakfast the first morning, I stopped by the front desk and mentioned that a plumbing problem had developed in my room. I was worrying all through breakfast about whether I'd have to stick around and make sure they sent somebody to fix it, but as I was downing my last sip of coffee, the desk clerk came in to let me know the job had already been taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “suburbanality in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: joshhikes
Reviews.Content: The plan was to stay at a non-gaming property and enjoy Las Vegas' outdoorsy mountains and hiking trails. This side of town is so suburbia, you could be in north Dallas or Ontario California and not see much difference, but the La Quinta is well situated near the Red Rocks park with outstanding views of the Spring Mountains just a short drive away. The hotel is a little hard to spot on Sahara, but there is everything in the way of stores and restaurants within a couple of miles. It only took a few minutes to drive out to Red Rocks, which I did each day, hiking Turtlehead Peak one day, crawling around in the Calico Rocks another, and taking out the camera & tripod another. You could be closer at the Red Rocks Casino, but it was nice to just have a plain vanilla hotel. Staff was friendly enough, the "bright side" breakfast was bright enough and plentiful. Also would have been reasonably convenient for Mt. Charleston hiking, but decided to stay lower and enjoyed Red Rocks mostly. Free Wifi worked ok in my room.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ben k
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very comfortable, but more importantly, the staff was terrific! They made certain that every need and concern was taken care of quickly, and with a smile. I was told they get alot of repeat guests, and I intend to be one of them! By the way, breakfast is great! Much more than a standard "continental breakfast"! Nice pool too. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: flo220
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine -- average, nothing special. Rooms are a decent size although the Queen suite with a queen size bed, a sofa sleeper and kitchenette it was a tight squeeze for three people. Breakfast is ok -- nothing special. The staff was helpful. When the air conditioning stopped working after our first night they accommodated my request to move. That said, the fact that they did not have a maintenance man on duty on a Friday morning was odd.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recomended”
Reviews.Author: thxmiker
Reviews.Content: La Quinta Inn has really stepped up their game! The Inn was very comfortable and the grounds well kept. When we were there, they were painting the outside and kept the noise and inconvenience to a minimum. The breakfast area was always spotless and the staff very polite. The pool area was sparse but well kept. Overall a very good experience! Our next stay in Vegas which is coming up soon will definitely be here. It is a 10 min drive to the strip or downtown. Many places to dine on Sahara.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice if you don't have pets and stay some where else.”
Reviews.Author: churchmom30
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation on line and that was the only thing that went right. We have never stayed in this hotel label before and this will be the last. The first room we were in was 119 and it smelled like someone lived in that room with multiple cats and were both allergic to cats, but the front desk person cheerfully changed our room to 135 and we thought things would be good only to walk into a room that smelled like someone lived in there and chained smoked and did I mention this is a 100% smoke free hotel. NOT! Then we said well at least its not cat smell so we get changed and get into bed only to hear elephants jumping around in the room above us. The only good thing I can say is the local dinning is good we ate at Fire Fly and it is yummy. Oh and I'm in the room writing this review and the beds not bad but really don't stay here it seems that people seem to live here rather than stay here for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: The_kosher_traveler
Reviews.Content: For a mini-suite (big room with kitchen) a price of less than $80 a night is outstanding. The front desk staff were genuinely friendly and helpful. Be aware that it is some distance from the Strip (but I wasn't there to play tourist anyway, so it was fine for me). I actually came back to Las Vegas in April and stayed again. Same high quality of service and value. If you are an Orthodox Jewish traveler (as I am) it has some additional pluses: it's convenient for kosher restaurants, it is literally next door to an Orthodox synagogue and they will (on request) put you in a room that has a traditional key rather than a key card. (If any of this is perplexing to you, just ignore it, none of it will impinge on your stay.)

Reviews.Title: “Average but nice rooms/amenities, good service, very good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: radioflyer0101
Reviews.Content: This La Quinta lived up to the expectations of a 2.5 star in Las Vegas very well. As expected, rooms were large, breakfast buffet was relatively extensive and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap decent quiet motel”
Reviews.Author: joedoe587
Reviews.Content: This a a good stay for those on a budget or who want to pay less than $100 for a quiet place to sleep. Rooms are big and apparently clean, and beds are comfortable. Free parking, internet, newspaper, continental breakfast, Quality of service varied depending on the employee, from good (late night staff) to clueless (breakfast). The location is good, near shopping, and for trips to the strip or downtown (15+ minutes) or to Red Rock Canyon (10+ minutes), the hidden jewel of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfiest bed ever”
Reviews.Author: Tripsterchick
Reviews.Content: Rarely do you find hotel beds and pillows as comfortable as this. Our room was quiet, clean, spacious and well-furnished with a sitting area, desk/table and kitchen (full-size fridge, two burners, microwave, pots and pans, dishes and cutlery). The hotel provides a continental breakfast that includes hot and cold cereal, boiled eggs, cream cheese, waffles, bagels, yogurt and fresh fruit. There’s plenty of parking, good in-room wifi and front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We chose the hotel because of its easy access to Red Rock Canyon, where we spent a day hiking. If you’re planning a similar excursion and want to put together a picnic, check out the excellent deli section at the Whole Foods Market located just a couple of blocks from the hotel. There’s lots of other good shopping in the area. Getting to the Strip doesn’t take too long either. All the big casinos provide free underground parking, so if you’re going to a show, don’t worry about what to do with your car once you get into town. The hotel is in a fairly residential area, so it’s quite serene in comparison to the Strip – which suited us just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: BearTravels33
Reviews.Content: Booked a jacuzzi suite and overall it was very nice. The room had a small kitchen, king bed, jacuzzi and a full bath. Room was clean and nicely decorated. They were doing some updating of the lobby and common areas but still managed to get everything setup for breakfast. Hotel was convenient to get to and had lots of dining options nearby. Staff was great and they got my room ready for early check-in so I could change clothes before going to my event!

Reviews.Title: “Quality, Very Clean, Pet Friendly, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ravineyard
Reviews.Content: Had to go to Las Vegas to take my dog to the vet. Chose La Quinta, a pet friendly hotel with stove, refrigerator, microwave, all kitchen supplies, that is surrounded by everything you would need on a vacation or business trip. Near hiking, biking trails,shopping, grocery store, pharmacy, casinos, many restaurants, movie theater, library (next door), quick-care, etc. It's a very short drive to the Las Vegas Strip. It was excellent. Quiet, spotless, excellent service, and clean small buffet breakfast. Quality!

Reviews.Title: “Great price - Relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: klondike459
Reviews.Content: Arrived late evening to the La Quinta at Red Rock/Summerlin hotel. Employee Venessa was at the front desk. After traveling with cranky airlines and passengers it was nice to be greeted by a person so late at night who was cheerful, super nice and had a beautiful smile. Checked me in quickly and explained how to set room temperature with room key card and provided the wireless internet access code. After I got to my room I needed to wash some clothes and found the Laundry Room washer and dryer prices very resonable. They even had a container of detergent in the room for guests (no cost). The bed was just right and the variety of pillows on the bed made for a great night's rest. The room had a full size refridgerator, microwave, sink and cups, dishes and eating utensils - which didn't need to use but glad to see it there as may need it on a return trip. No USA Today newspaper at my door in the AM. Learned they receive only a set number and I was odd man out. Breakfast was good, OJ was watered down. Otherwise I would definately stay here again the next time I end up in 'Vegas on business.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!!”
Reviews.Author: JannatheMom
Reviews.Content: OK, so yes, the hotel is not Sheraton; it isn' new and trendy, but totally worth every penny! Nice, large, heated pool and hot tub (we used the pool when it was 60 outside and were plenty warm!); huge breakfast with three choices of fruit (but the coffee wasn't good at all - I am an espresso person:) and freshly made waffles; and finally HUGE rooms with fridge, microwave, toaster and a coffee maker. It was more like a studio apart. - not just a room at the hotel. It was clean, fresh towels by the pool and in the room every day. Once again, the linens are not Hilton grade, but clean and the bed was comfy. We used the pool every day - very clean and inviting, plenty of space. Our 5 year old said she wants to stay in the place like this every time we travel! Swinning pool was GREAT!!!! Consider if you have a child!! Two reasons why I gave it 4 stars and not 5: 1) the folks upstairs were so noisy, we could hear literally every stomp on the floor. Took forever to fall asleep one night. 2) Stay here only if you like dogs - the hotel is pet friendly. We didn't mind pets, but we could tell the room wasn't as nice because someone with the pet stayed there ( the sofa where my kid slept was ripped a bit, we noticed some pet hair in a few places - but nothing drastic). You will see pets all the time, so be ready. If you are a pet lover, or a dog owner - this is for sure the place for you! It is far from the streep and action, which in our case was great. Close to the grocery stores, shopping and restaurants. Easy access to highways. We would absolutely stay there next time we are in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: darrylsferns
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect for those with tight budget... It is one of the only hotels that allow pets... it is pretty far from the strip... but is located in a very quiet neighborhood... I loved the place... and to top it all, the service was absolutely brilliant... :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to visit Red Rock Canyon”
Reviews.Author: PrivateTravelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and well maintained, the stuff friendly. Rooms are clean and spacious, breakfast was as you can expect a complimentary continental breakfast. This is the perfect place to stay if you want to visit Red Rock, Valley of Fire, or Lake Mead. You need a car to go to the strip. The hotel is quiet, and has no gambling. There are many shoppings mall nearby, and a few restaurants. You can escape LV avoiding the heavy downtown traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oldbarbri
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just what you look for in an economy business hotel. Nice breakfast in the morning, free wireless internet, clean rooms with fridge/microwave/toaster, inexpensive, and clean. The beds aren't that great, but the rest is very good.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: rdw58
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights there as our daugther and family live in re rock so it was really convenient.No complaints about road noise or anything else.It was priced right and continental breakfast was very good.I have stayed at la quinta before and will in the future and as grandkids grow up would stay here on a regular basis for our cross country trips to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Needs major revamping”
Reviews.Author: foodwinechickie
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice and check-in went smoothly, but the hotel is really not up-to-par. My room was not clean, the rug was so used that there were patches of carpet in several places. The bathroom was dirty. I don't often stay in value hotels, but this can't be as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: kifu
Reviews.Content: I arrived a little early, but a room was ready for me. The desk staff was always cordial and friendly. The room was very very clean. Cleaner than my own house! But that's another review. There is absolutely no street noise from Sahara Avenue ... the hotel is set back perhaps 300 yards from the street (maybe more, I'm not that good at estimating distance). I also heard little to no noises coming from other rooms (I was in 102). It would not recommend rooms 100 and 101 as they are near the back doors (key card required to enter) and although the doors closed fairly easily, they did make a little noise upon closing. The breakfast was quite good if you like carbs! Well, not quite true because there was also yogurt and fruit every day. I stayed there three nights and my only possible complaint would be that there was no hair conditioner, only shampoo. Oh, I was surprised the first morning to find an Internet copy of my hometown newspaper slipped under the door. What a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Ami89
Reviews.Content: Although I only stayed one night at La Quinta, what I saw of it was v.good and excellent for value. Our room was v.large and fairly modern with two massive king size beds. If I were visiting Las Vegas again I would definately choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant change from typical Vegas casino hotel stays”
Reviews.Author: 31000miles
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas by automobile monthly for a week of business and this particular La Quinta is a welcome, comfortable and convenient 'home away from home'. There are 6 restaurants, 4 fast food venues and a multi-screen theater in the adjacent shopping mall. A Whole Foods Market is 3-minutes driving nearby and a food court visit there helps break up the monotony of regular business travel when I actually taking advantage of a suite's sofa and table. I usually avoid casino/hotel lodging and the hospitality at this particular LQ will bring you back. I have never become aware of traffic 'rumble' as the property sets back over a block from Sahara Blvd. The management and staff actually understand 'hospitality', a concept rapidly disappearing from too many chain hotels, regardless of size. Try it and you'll like it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Ketzel
Reviews.Content: I wonder if I stayed at the same place as the previous reviewer. The hotel is set well back off the road in an expensive looking neighborhood. The room was quite large and well appointed, as was the tv. Everything seemed spotless. The breakfast was amazing. If this was continental, I can't imagine what a full breakfast would be like. They even had hard-boiled eggs and sausage rolls in addition to make your own waffles. Short of a full breakfast buffet, I've never seen a breakfast so good. The staff was obliging, upgrading our room when we were unhappy with what we received. Booking on the hotel's own website is important if there's a mistake. I've found this at other hotels too - they are not thrilled with you if you use a secondary site and the prices aren't necessarily cheaper. The value here is quite good too.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for conditions”
Reviews.Author: sandag2
Reviews.Content: Just passing through one evening with dogs -- only place in Vegas that we could find that would take dogs. Room was average size, only averagely clean. We were on side facing Sahara and traffic was VERY loud. Sirens all night and cars zooming by non-stop. TV was small and old. Staff was fine. We didn't spend anytime in lobby or elsewhere in hotel. Neighborhood seemed a little sketchy as well, but then again.. .. you're in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suites at an Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: blight
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a suite, instead of a cramped room, at an affordable price, then this hotel is definitely a very viable option. The room had a full kitchen, sofa and a comfortable bed. For the same price of a standard room on the strip, you get a nice studio apartment. They offered free pastries and juices to guests of the hotel in the lounge area. As far as location goes, the hotel is located within a mile of the Red Rock, Suncoast and Rampart casinos. It's right near an art museum and movie theatre, so plenty of family fun nearby. The strip is about 15 minutes away by car. If you are Jewish, the hotel is located right next to the Young Israel of Las Vegas. So this is a great place to stay for Shabbat. I highly recommend this hotel for small families who don't want to be stuck in a cramped room or be next to the craziness of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, especially when traveling with pets”
Reviews.Author: Hokiephile
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this LQ about four times now in 2007. The longest was for four nights when I was moving to California and had a friend and my three cats with me. The cats loved the windows because the sills were wide enough for them to sit in and watch the world go by. The rooms are nice, large, and well equipped. The free internet is a definite plus. They've always been clean and I especially like the rooms that come with a full kitchen. Only complaint I have is the most recent trip when I reserved a room with two beds. When we arrived in Las Vegas I called the LQ to let them know we were in town but wouldn't be able to check in until midnight as we were going to a show. I didn't want them to give my room away because they thought I wasn't coming. And by the way, it was a free room because I was using my LQ points to pay for it. When we arrived at midnight and checked in, there was only one bed in the room. We called down and he said the sofa was a pull-out and they were sorry there were no rooms with two beds we could move to. Okay, it was after midnight, and it was a free room so we could make do. However, the sofa wasn't a pull-out. It was just a sofa. Fortunately, my friend said she slept on her sofa all the time, usually in the company of a dalmation, so having it all to herself would be fine. The next morning she said it was very comfortable. It would have been nice to have the room I reserved, but it all worked out fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great shabbat hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hankn
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta is a very nice facility. The rooms are clean and spacious. They have the free breakfast and the free Internet. No laundry facilities, though. They have hard keys for the sabbath and they need to be left at the front desk. Problem is after 10pm on Friday night one needs to use a keycard to get the front doors to open so one has to knock to get them to open the doors. There are two synagogues right next door - the Young Israel and a newer one lead by Rabbi Ever, which is in an office building in front of the LaQuinta. If you need to stay over shabbat in Las Vegas, the best option is to move to the LaQunita. During the week, it is 25 minutes from the Strip so it is a bit far for most people.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: DuffyMo
Reviews.Content: We thought this place was the best we stayed in out of 6 total hotels/motels we stayed at during a recent road trip. Had a nice big room with kitchen/living area/king bed on the first floor, which was very convenient as we had a dog. Everything was new, clean and in great shape! The kitchen was well-stocked. I liked the fact they gave us 4 towels in the room (where most other places in this price range tend to give you only 2, which is a pain!)(the La Quinta website for this location has accurate pictures of what this place looks like--if anything, I think it looks better in person.) The staff was very helpful & accommodating during check-in. Includes a breakfast which is more than continental & very well run and stocked. Free internet access! It's in a good part of town (unlike our last stay where we were near the L.V. convention center. Scary!) BUT it is NOT close to the gambling/Strip if that's what you're there for. It's a good 9 miles west of the Strip down a very busy main street. But if I were in Las Vegas to gamble I would probably still stay here again because it's nice to be away from all "action" after a while. Cost us $107 (incl tax) which I thought was very reasonable for what you got. Highly recommend!

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Las Vegas RedRock/Summerlin
HotelInfo.Address: 9570 West Sahara, Las Vegas, NV 89117
